name: biddlebubbly
text: Ray is none too happy about drinking the inverse wine.

name: peppermint
text: Theguy's head is seeping . I wouldn't put anything he gave me into my body.

name: mikebox
text: Yet Ray responds to the possibility of alcohol with a quickness!

name: epicurus
text:
I think Ray jerked quickly to get the glass just because this whole Cartilege head situation was so uncomfortable that he is desperate to do what it takes.

Kind of like when you're a dorky teenage boy and you first meet your girlfriend's strict father. He offers his hand to you, it takes you a second to realize you're supposed to shake it, and then you jerk your hand into his.

name: subtilior
text: I assumed he was more weeping than seeping.

name: rowboat
text: He's weeping what he's seeping.

name: boredom_man
text: I would drink absolutely anything that might make me less conscious or alive, by this point.

name: vweep
text: And yet I can't help but feel, that the entire punchline of this story arc is in the alt text...

name: greyfield
text: Man, the inverse wine bottle is the coolest thing ever. I would pay significant money for one of those.

name: rach4ael
text: this was the coolest idea ever, I want that wine bottle

name: soticoto
text: A comment left by soticoto was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by brynito, TapaidhNaomh, rascaldom, BrianNotBrian, aesop_punk, RogueCheddar, scraggg)

name: soticoto
text: Would someone mind explaining to me why so many people hate Captain Morgan?

name: coconutjohn
text: A comment left by coconutjohn was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by joeyramoney, greymantledwolf, Ariamaki, Taidje_Khan)

name: mastronaut
text: Because of Science.

name: aiglos
text: You could construct a wine spigot inside a bottle that used optical effects to appear empty. Victory, Science!

name: tekende
text: What we need less of is science

name: charchar
text: What we need more of is Magical Realism.

name: norsef
text:
I can sort of see how it could be done.
At the bottom of the bottle you can see a small indentation which conceals the outlet for the wine reservoir. A reservoir as wide as the table but only half an inch thick could hold at least one bottle and could still be hidden from a casual search. The bottom of the wine glass has a small valve (the kind found in a vein) made of transparent rubber with a hollow stalk. When pushed down a concealed transparent pipe from the reservoir is pushed through the valve by the weight of the glass. The pump is then activated out of sight, a button under the table most likely. The wine going through the stalk is hidden because the stream is thin, note how long it takes to fill, and the glass reflecting off glass obscures the fluid. The glass is then twisted off the hidden pipe, or the pipe slowly withdrawn, so the valve remains airtight as the glass is given to your terrified friend.

The only problem off the top of my head is that of hiding the sound of a pump. But Cartilage Head seems like he'd have music playing.

name: heccibiggs
text: Make this happen.

name: charchar
text: You are some kind of genius.

name: norsef
text: I just thought you could get the pump issue by using a long enema tube with a squeezy ball pump instead of a reservoir. Ten foot or so could make a kink free circuit under the table, perhaps with a fake bottom, whilst it already comes with a tapered end for easy insertion. The down sides? Using the squeezy pump unseen and the fact you have to ask the girl in the chemist for "a massive enema set".

name: atticusonline
text:
I have many enema sets in my house!

This is not something I should tell everyone!

name: onepapertiger
text: Oh Phillipe.

name: aargh
text: Apparantly I've given out too many chubbies, so this'll have to do: chubby.

name: asherdan
text: A comment left by asherdan was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by plummet, GeyserShitdick, jollysaintpete, Semiquaver, atticusonline, HappyCat)

name: hipjiverobot
text: Wow, this is the only asherdan comment I've seen that doesn't have at least 3 'lames'.

name: saint
text: ...the hell?

name: envika
text: truly not all asherdan comments deserve lames, it's just a kneejerk reaction at this point.

name: jbacardi
text: I do believe this is the first asherdan comment I've ever seen. A historic night!

name: peterjoel
text:
I swear, I saw an asherdan comment recently, with 16 chubbies and ZERO lames. If you can beat that, I guess I owe you a dollar.

Hint: I think you can not do this.

name: swatson
text:
Tee hee. His comment has exactly three lames right now.
This is funny for me. :D

name: djwhiterabbit
text: baffling.

name: lawdog
text: Words become superfluous with such eloquent eyebrows.

name: tombsgrave
text: That wine is haunted.  Ray is wise to resist drinking until it's known it won't start trying to slosh around eerily.

name: crinklebat
text: Ray in the last panel just nails it. The shaking, the face that so perfectly captures trying to decide whether or not it's a good idea...god, Cartilage Head is creepy.

name: afkpuz
text: This reminds me a lot of that wine scene in A Clockwork Orange.

name: deusoma
text: Starting to remind me of the chicken scene in Eraserhead. As in, screwed up beyond all belief.

name: zedpower
text: I love Ray's hurry to get his glass in panel 3. Like he's thinking "yes! wine! I know what wine is! wine is good!" And then that bottle yanks the floor from under him. He can't even trust wine anymore.

name: spinynorman
text:
I think Ray is actually thinking, "OH FUCK! OH FUCK!" and probably has been for the past twenty minutes.

Listen a seven-foot guy with rubber bones and black eyes has you cornered in his art-nouveau apartment. You are going to do anything he says with quickness and what you hope is a veneer of enthusiasm.

name: jar
text: What a beautiful observation.

name: cailetshadow
text: Am I the only one who thinks that Ray is is about as eager to drink that wine as he would be to drop a scorpion into his thong?

name: cailetshadow
text: I mean, seriously, he looks like he's about to cry.

name: halfdirt
text: It turns out though in the next strip that the wine is good.

name: slab64
text: Spoilerz

name: centipede_damascus
text: seriously, this needs to be a short animated film

name: jalhalla42
text: All Sigur Ros playing in the background

name: c_dizzle
text: I want one. ....I WANT ONE!

name: sardoniclaconic
text: Appropriately, this was published on my 21st birthday.

name: mshendry
text: sorry but i don't get this story arc

name: sirfrederick
text: That's okay but I do.

name: tunafreedolphin
text: Exactly what motion is Cartilage Head making in the 14th and 15th panel?

name: diggidy
text: The walking cadaver implores you to drink the un-wine.

name: heccibiggs
text: Aahhh hahaha I love your avatar.

name: rowboat
text: I can't figure out if his avatar is really sweet or if it's incredibly sick.

name: rowboat
text: I'm referring only to the child and the dog portions. Didn't want anyone to think I was a bigot. I suddenly care what the internet thinks of me.

name: cagliostro
text: But it's too late!

name: heccibiggs
text: I was actually talking about tunafreedolphin's avatar. Not really a fan of diggidy's, personally.

name: rowboat
text: Yeah, I realized that about a year later. Because I'm a genius.

name: xiaomimi
text:
Today's Blogs

Teodor: Weekend's cooking plans.

name: dasuta
text: He is fiddling with his hands, and then he is posing the thought "Does it displease you? No?  Then drink, please!"

name: direhaggis
text: Just the suggestion of Ray's hand even getting near the dude-thing in panel 4 is terribly unnerving. Fingers all like living pasta, skin all clammy, weird breathing likely making the rounds. I emphasize: direct bozack killing.

name: unsentletter
text: Secrets.

name: whoper
text: Onstad draws a seriously rad wineglass and bottle.  I guess it would detract from the ambience if he didn't.

name: salvagebar
text:
Holy crispy crap, this is so frightening.

Also, I dig the half-circle accent at the top of each of Cartilage Head's cards, as well as the monogrammed 'CH'.

name: carlyle
text:
I have a diagram of how that would work, but I can't describe it.
Also, this arc is my favorite forever.

name: brokendrum
text:
I realise I'm a few years late to this party, but I couldnt help being reminded of that scene from the movie Legend, where the devil fills up the girls wine glass the same way by only pointing at it.

Sit.

Drink.

name: elsewhere
text: So Disturbed! I cannot stop laughing for some terrible reason! What does it say about me that this sort of thing has me chortling and wheezing for minutes on end? Nothing good, I'd wager.
